comment.body: The reason ZeroMail's received messages keep reappearing is that the content on disk doesn't change; instead, the browser's [local storage](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Web_Storage_API) (clearnet) stores a list of messages to not display. Naturally, if you use the Tor browser or wipe your local storage somehow, those messages will reappear. Haven't tested deleting sent messages, but as you are the one with the private key of the json those messages are stored under, it is possible to actually delete them.
